## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 327, 356, 344]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Pure Mathematics 2 (P2)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 415, 390, 433]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 446, 787, 463]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 463, 330, 478]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 478, 504, 494]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 494, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 509, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 540, 285, 555]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 555, 910, 586]]<|/det|>
Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 585, 598, 600]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 600, 606, 616]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 629, 609, 645]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 644, 756, 660]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 660, 440, 676]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 50.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 910, 92]]<|/det|>
Use logarithms to solve the equation \(5^{3x - 1} = 2^{4x}\), giving your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 732, 92]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(x\) satisfies the equation \(|x + 1| = 4\). Find the possible values of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 98, 562, 118]]<|/det|>
\[|x + 4| - |x - 4|.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 100, 920, 117]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 111]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y = \tan \frac{1}{2}x + 3 \sin \frac{1}{2}x\). The curve has a stationary point \(M\) in the interval \(\pi < x < 2\pi\). Find the coordinates of \(M\), giving each coordinate correct to 3 significant figures. [6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula based on the equation in part **(i)** to find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(Q\) correct to 3 significant figures. Give the result of each iteration to 5 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 84, 99, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 83, 148, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 75, 579, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{\frac{1}{4}\pi} \sin x (4 \sin x + 6 \cos x) \, \mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 84, 148, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 73, 740, 112]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\int_{0}^{a} \frac{6}{3x + 2} \mathrm{~d}x = \ln 49\), find the value of the positive constant \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 920, 101]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 482, 92]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(x^{2} + 4xy + 2y^{2} = 7.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 104, 156, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at the point \((-1, 3)\). Give your answer in the form \(ax + by + c = 0\) where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 688, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that there is no point on the curve at which the gradient is \(\frac{1}{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]
